intro: Henckelia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Henckelia hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
